title: If You Can Only Buy One Metaverse Stock, It Better Be One of These 3 Names
text: Analysts from Bloomberg Intelligence project that the metaverse might achieve an $800 billion valuation by 2024. This prospect attracts investors seeking prime metaverse stocks.

title: It's Microsoft Earnings Day. Watch AI and the Cloud.
text: Shares of the software giant are up 44% so far this year, recently setting a record high.

title: The problem with X? Meta, Microsoft, hundreds more own trademarks to new Twitter name
text: Billionaire Elon Musk's decision to rebrand Twitter as X could be complicated legally: companies including Meta and Microsoft already have intellectual property rights to the same letter.

title: Dow Up 10 Straight Sessions; NXPI Beats, WHR Mixed
text: NXP Semi topped estimates on both top and bottom lines, while Whirlpool beat easily on earnings but missed on revenues.

title: 7 Smart Stocks to Buy if You Believe the Inflation Battle Is Far From Over
text: Inflation resistant stocks might seem an idea destined for gradual irrelevance based on economic reports from the past few weeks. First up, the headline print of the June jobs report came in lower than expected, representing a rather sharp pivot from prior labor market data.

title: Stock Market Starts Huge Week With Gains As Dow Extends Win Streak To 11 Sessions; This Is How Much Microsoft Lost In Nasdaq 100 Rebalance
text: The stock market started the week with gains. The Nasdaq 100 rebalance cut the weighting of Microsoft, Nvidia and others.

title: Microsoft's Bing Chat comes to Chrome and Safari in tests for ‘select users'
text: Microsoft's AI chatbot, Bing Chat, is coming to non-Microsoft browsers the company today confirmed following various reports of the AI chatbot being spotted in other browsers like Google Chrome and Apple's Safari.

title: Will Cloud Computing Results Aid Big Tech Earnings?
text: Cloud computing has become a major focus in the market over the last several years, with the technology allowing companies and consumers to achieve digital feats that otherwise felt impossible.

title: Microsoft may be forced to share user data with Saudi Arabia after investing $2B in cloud storage facility
text: At a tech conference in Saudi Arabia earlier this year, officials announced that Microsoft has invested $2 billion in building a cloud storage facility in the kingdom. Privacy pundits are warning against what the move means for data security.

title: Microsoft Corporation has a 'transformational AI Gold Rush opportunity,' analysts say
text: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) will report earnings after the bell Tuesday, which analysts at Wedbush say offers “no better barometer” of the cloud and enterprise sector.  In a note to clients, Wedbush reiterated its Outperform rating and $375 price target.

title: Microsoft, Alphabet and Meta are set to report and AI is adding to the the bull case for tech stocks
text: It's a big week for the tech sector as heavyweights including Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT), Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG) and Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:FB), among others, prepare to unveil their second-quarter results. Following a robust performance in the first half of 2023, analysts at Wedbush believe the Street now needs to see what the “AI Revolution” holds for the sector heading into the remainder of the year and 2024.

title: Three Tech Titans to Report Earnings: ETFs in Spotlight
text: Three of the seven biggest tech players - Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL) and Meta Platforms (META) - are set to report this week.

title: Markets Wait For Fed FOMC
text: We expect another big week in the market indices, what with Q2 earnings season gaining traction in industries beyond banking, a big Personal Consumption Expenditure (PCE) report out Friday morning, and, of course, the next Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting starting tomorrow and concluding with new interest rate policy Wednesday. It's now widely expected that a 25 basis-point (bps) rate hike is on the way — the first rate hike since early May, which (temporarily?

title: Earnings Previews: Alphabet, Microsoft, Visa
text: No notable earnings reports were released late Friday or early Monday morning.

title: AI Over? Is Slowdown in ChatGPT Traffic a Sign of AI Fatigue?
text: 2023 will be remembered as the breakout year for artificial intelligence (AI), with credit given to the explosive viral growth of ChatGPT. The ChatGPT broke records when it surpassed over 100 million users five days after launch.

title: Rightpoint, a Genpact Company, is Named a Top Microsoft US Partner for Second Year in a Row
text: CHICAGO--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Rightpoint, a global experience leader and Genpact company, has been honored with the prestigious 2023 Microsoft US Partner of the Year Award for Modern Work: Employee Experience, in recognition of its Total Experience approach. This marks the second consecutive year that Rightpoint has been acknowledged by Microsoft for its exceptional work. The company has also been named as a finalist in two worldwide categories, Employee Experience and Modern Workplace for Frontlin.

title: 7 Stocks to Double Your Money in Today's Markets
text: The stock market continues to rip higher. And this year, the gains are primarily concentrated in technology stocks, specifically companies that are involved in artificial intelligence.

title: AI stocks poised for a pullback: Top 3 picks to watch
text: Artificial intelligence stocks, including chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA), Microsoft (MSFT), and C3.ai (AI), soared in 2023, outperforming the S&P 500 by a considerable margin. With gains north of 200% year to date, two of these stocks stand in heavily overbought territory.

title: Microsoft, Google, and the Fed are all in focus ahead of a make-or-break week for the 2023 stock-market rally
text: Get ready for a make-or-break five days for stocks. Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet, and Meta will all report their second-quarter earnings, while the Federal Reserve is set to make its latest interest-rate decision.

title: Dow looks to extend winning streak as central bank decisions and raft of earnings loom
text: U.S. stock futures nudged higher Monday as traders eyed a flurry of central bank and earnings action over coming days.
